data.title: How's the Weather in Rome in November?
data.meta_description: This post provides details about what kind of weather to expect in Rome throughout the month of November, including tips on things to do and what to wear.
data.text:
In this post, we explain the weather in Rome during the month of November.

As both your tour guide and a retired meteorologist, I use my combined skills to offer reliable weather forecasts for this month.

This ensures you stay informed and ready for any weather scenarios during our tour.

We include average temperatures, how much rain to expect, as well as tips on what to pack.

Weather in October

How Hot is Rome in November?

Daytime high temperatures tend to be around 18-19 C (65-67 F) early in the month but fall to near 14-16 C (58-61 F) by the end of the month.

A few of the warmer afternoons, especially early in November, can reach up near 23 C (73 F).

The record high temperature in Rome during November is 30 C (86 F).

Late night and early morning low temperatures tend to be near 9-10 C (48-50 F) early in the month, falling to around 6-8 C (43-46 F) near the end of the month.

A few of the colder mornings, especially late in the month, can dip down near 1 C (34 F).

The record low temperature in Rome during November is -5 (23 F).

Sun and Rain

During November, Rome will normally experience about 12 sunny, 2 partly sunny, and about 16 mostly cloudy days.

About 8-10 days record some rainfall, however, only about 4 days will record rainfalls of 10 mm (0.4 inches) or more.

Daylight

The number of daylight hours decreases this month from about 10.4 hours on the 1st to about 9.4 hours by the 30th.

Windspeed

The wind speeds during this month are mostly light to gentle averaging 6-19 kph (4-12 mph), however, can occasionally be moderate at 20-28 kph (13-18 mph).

Ocean and Beaches

Within about an hour of the city are several good beaches.

However, water temperatures will be a bit chilly this month, falling from about 20 C (68 F) early in the month to near 17 C (63 F) by the end of the month.

What to Wear in Rome in November

Weather in Rome during November becomes chilly, so a mix of Autumn and some winter attire is suggested.

This includes long skirts, long pants or jeans, a couple of sweaters, and at least one medium-weight jacket or coat for the colder nights and mornings.

Please bring along an umbrella for rainy days and donâ€™t forget some comfortable walking shoes.

If you plan to visit the Vatican, best to check their dress code first.

Things to Do in Rome in November

Although there will more than likely be quite a few cloudy days in November, there should also be several sunny days.

Depending on when you visit, you might want to consider a pay-what-you-wish walking tour in Rome.

If you do end up visiting on a rainy day, consider heading to the Pantheon for an interesting visual experience, as the rain will fall (at a slightly decreased rate) inside the building!

Roma Europa will still be in full swing this November, which means there should be several excellent theatrical performances to enjoy this month.

Alternatively, you could also attend a concert of the Three Tenors or see the opera La Traviata, both of which are performed on a weekly basis at St. Paul's Within the Walls.

For even more ideas, make sure to check our full post covering things to do in Rome in November.

Fred Pickhardt

Ocean Weather Services
